{{Infobox album | Name = Bastards | Type = [[Remix album]] | Artist = [[Björk]] | Cover = Björk bastards cover.jpeg | Released = 19 November 2012 | Recorded = 2008–11 | Genre = {{flatlist| * [[Electronica]] * [[Experimental music|experimental]] * [[Alternative music|alternative]] * [[Intelligent dance music|IDM]] * [[worldbeat]] * [[drum and bass]] * [[art pop]] * [[downtempo]] }} | Length = | Label = [[One Little Indian]] | Producer = {{flatlist| * [[Björk]] * [[Mark Bell (British musician)|Mark Bell]] * [[Omar Souleyman]] * [[Hudson Mohawke]] * [[Death Grips]] * [[These New Puritans]] * [[Matthew Herbert]] * [[16bit]] * [[Alva Noto]] * [[The Slips]] * Current Value }} | Last album = ''[[Biophilia (album)|Biophilia]]''
(2011) | This album = '''''Bastards'''''
(2012) | Next album = ''[[Björk: Biophilia Live]]''
(2014) }} {{Album reviews | rev1 = Aesthetic Magazine Toronto | rev1Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{cite web |url=http://aestheticmagazinetoronto.com/2012/11/28/album-review-bjorks-bastards-delivers-collection-of-biophilia-remixes-that-explore-new-sonic-horizons/ |title=Album Review: Björk’s "Bastards" Delivers Collection Of "Biophilia" Remixes That Explore New Sonic Horizons |first=Calum |last=Slingerland|date={{date|November 28, 2012|mdy}} |publisher=[[Aesthetic Magazine Toronto]]}} | rev2 = [[Consequence of Sound]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{cite web |url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2012/12/album-review-bjork-bastards/ |title=Album Review: Björk – bastards' |first=Sarah H. |last=Grant |date={{date|December 5, 2012|mdy}} |publisher=[[Consequence of Sound]]}} }} '''''Bastards''''' (stylized as '''''bastards'''''){{cite web|title=BJÖRK bastards|url=http://indian.co.uk/shop/bastards-1.html|accessdate=12 October 2012}} is the third remix album by [[Iceland]]ic artist [[Björk]], it was released on 19 November 2012.{{cite web|last=Pelly|first=Jenn|title=Björk Announces Biophilia Remix Album, bastards|url=http://pitchfork.com/news/48134-bjork-announces-biophilia-remix-album-bastards/|publisher=[[Pitchfork Media]]|accessdate=9 October 2012}} The album features remixes of tracks from her eighth studio album, ''[[Biophilia (album)|Biophilia]]'' (2011). All of the remixes were previously released on ''[[Crystalline (song)|The Crystalline Series]]'' or the [[Biophilia (album)#Biophilia Remix Series|''Biophilia'' Remix Series]], and they were all remastered by Mandy Parnell. ==Background== Although all tracks had already been released, Björk "felt it important to gather together the essence of the remixes" so she "picked a quarter of them for one CD for people who are perhaps not too sassy [sic] downloaders or don't have the time or energy to partake in the hunter-gathering rituals of the internet".{{cite web|title=BJÖRK ANNOUNCES REMIX ALBUM ENTITLED BASTARDS FEATURING HUDMO, DEATH GRIPS|url=http://www.factmag.com/2012/10/08/bjork-announces-remix-album-entitled-bastards-featuring-hudmo-death-grips/|accessdate=12 October 2012}} The cover features the 'strata' persona Björk adopted for the "[[Mutual Core]]" music video which was directed by Andrew Thomas Huang. ==Track listing== {{Track listing | extra_column = Producer(s) | writing_credits = yes | title1 = [[Crystalline (song)|Crystalline]] | note1 = Omar Souleyman Remix | writer1 = [[Björk]] | extra1 = {{flatlist| * Björk * 16bit (adaptation by [[Omar Souleyman]]) }} | length1 = 6:39 | title2 = [[Virus (Björk song)|Virus]] | note2 = Hudson Mohawke Peaches and Guacamol Remix | writer2 = {{flatlist| * Björk * [[Sjón]] }} | extra2 = Björk (remix by [[Hudson Mohawke]]) | length2 = 4:49 | title3 = Sacrifice | note3 = [[Death Grips]] Remix | writer3 = Björk | extra3 = Björk (remix by [[Death Grips]]) | length3 = 4:17 | title4 = Sacrifice | note4 = Matthew Herbert's Pins and Needles Mix Edit | writer4 = Björk | extra4 = Björk (remix and additional production by [[Matthew Herbert]]) | length4 = 0:37 | title5 = [[Mutual Core]] | note5 = These New Puritans Remix featuring Solomon Islands Song | writer5 = Björk | length5 = 3:54 | extra5 = Björk (remix by [[These New Puritans]]) | title6 = Hollow | note6 = [[16bit]] Remix | writer6 = Björk | extra6 = {{flatlist| * Björk * 16bit (remix by [[16bit]]) }} | length6 = 7:00 | title7 = Mutual Core | note7 = Matthew Herbert's Tectonic Plates Mix | writer7 = Björk | extra7 = Björk (remix and additional production by Matthew Herbert) | length7 = 5:05 | title8 = Thunderbolt | note8 = Death Grips Remix | writer8 = {{flatlist| * Björk * Oddný Eir Ævarsdóttir }} | extra8 = Björk (remix by [[Death Puritans Remix featuring Solomon Islands Song) includes samples from the Traditional composition "Funeral Song (Solomon Islands 1978)", as extracted from the album ''Spirit of Melanesia'' by [[David Fanshawe]]. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !scope="col"|Chart (2012) !scope="col"|Peak

Hung Medien |accessdate=31 March 2014}} |align="center"|154 |- !scope="row"|[[UK Albums Chart]]{{cite web|title=Chart Log UK 2012|url=http://zobbel.de/cluk/CLUK2012.HTM|accessdate=31 March 2014}} |align="center"|199 |- !scope="row"|[[UK Indie Chart|UK Indie Albums Chart]]{{cite web|title=2012 Top 40 Independent Albums Archive 1st December 2012|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/archive-chart/_/13/2012-12-01/|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|accessdate=31 March 2014}} |align="center"|30 |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Björk}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bastards (Bjork album)}} [[Category:2012 remix albums]] [[Category:Björk albums]] [[Category:One Little Indian Records albums]] [[Category:Polydor Records albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Hudson Mohawke]] [[Category:Albums produced by Mark Bell (British musician)]]
